title: Not syncing blocks, stuck on 2/15 Headers stage and not updating rpc last block
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`

erigon version 2.43.0-stable-1106475e

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX

Linux

Commit hash: 

1106475e345d936aa1220ace3e95d746ec361fa4

Erigon Command (with flags/config):

./build/bin/erigon --datadir mainnet    --txpool.api.addr=erigon:9090 --internalcl  

Concensus Layer:

internal 

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):

Chain/Network: 
ethereum mainnet
 
#### Expected behaviour

get last block synced when request to rpc 


#### Actual behaviour

it takes more than one day to update last block when requesting to rpc. Sync process is stuck on   2/15 Headers stage, and after 24h or more process bodies,  and update value when request to rpc. 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "eth_blockNumber", "params": [], "id":1}' localhost:8545
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"0x10bbe36"}

[INFO] [06-26|13:24:09.447] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=1 eth68=33 eth67=32
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:32.830] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=17563283 hash=0x7000d2b501afb2e81c4ed1635232bea981c6c831af482372953a98cb6a4c8da3
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:32.839] [2/15 Headers] Downloading PoS headers... height=17563282 hash=0xbf25027dab259b7fc62871bef4001732d47b8fba42251bd82997dcdaedfb2d65 requestId=996
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:32.839] [2/15 Headers] DONE                      in=1m41.100074154s
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:33.199] PoS headers verified and saved           requestId=996 fork head=0xfdbe205276535ba0de365c7633b245cef9a80dd4d1b3291e1df2f5fe9542c826
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:33.213] [2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer... 
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:33.213] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=17563283 hash=0x7000d2b501afb2e81c4ed1635232bea981c6c831af482372953a98cb6a4c8da3
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:33.225] [2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer... 
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:38.853] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=17563284 hash=0x242c1c8f28a3a18a69616688f9373be02f70cd4c0c32c533fdba907ed55a014a
[INFO] [06-26|13:24:38.869] [2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer... 
[INFO] [06-26|13:25:00.595] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=17563286 hash=0x1026bf3d957c59bf262abcd35b54ad61e980c2a4fcb2f30706b2300b8cf16f59
[INFO] [06-26|13:25:00.604] [2/15 Headers] Downloading PoS headers... height=17563285 hash=0xa8e63ccefa76272a81edbc88125be873958711b6d71282ae9d6b18bbd0968ad1 requestId=998
[INFO] [06-26|13:25:01.296] PoS headers verified and saved           requestId=998 fork head=0x242c1c8f28a3a18a69616688f9373be02f70cd4c0c32c533fdba907ed55a014a
[INFO] [06-26|13:25:01.309] [2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer... 
[INFO] [06-26|13:25:01.309] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=17563286 hash=0x1026bf3d957c59bf262abcd35b54ad61e980c2a4fcb2f30706b2300b8cf16f59


#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

by runing 

 ./build/bin/erigon --datadir mainnet  --rpc.batch.limit 1  --txpool.api.addr=erigon:9090 --internalcl  --torrent.download.rate=20mb   2>&1   & 

Get process download block bodies one by one   but rpc last block still not updated to the last one. 
 
[INFO] [06-27|16:43:01.206] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=17557377 delivery/sec=2.2MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=11578 delivered=16896 cache=222.2MB alloc=3.2GB sys=5.1GB
[INFO] [06-27|16:43:17.130] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth68=2 eth67=2
[INFO] [06-27|16:43:21.205] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=17557393 delivery/sec=2.0MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=11562 delivered=17284 cache=255.9MB alloc=3.4GB sys=5.1GB
[INFO] [06-27|16:43:41.188] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=9300 alloc=3.7GB sys=5.1GB
[INFO] [06-27|16:43:41.205] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=17557410 delivery/sec=2.1MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=11545 delivered=17682 cache=255.9MB alloc=3.7GB sys=5.1GB
[INFO] [06-27|16:43:43.163] [Caplin] P2P                             peers=1
[INFO] [06-27|16:44:01.205] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=17557427 delivery/sec=1.9MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=11545 delivered=18044 cache=253.9MB alloc=3.9GB sys=5.1GB
[INFO] [06-27|16:44:21.206] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies   block_num=17557442 delivery/sec=2.2MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=11513 delivered=18397 cache=256.0MB alloc=4.2GB sys=5.1GB
it's feature. blocks will be available after execution/indexing/etc... after pass all stages: `[5/15 Bodies]`

So it's not possible to access the blocks via rpc every 10 seconds, i.e. how are they created on the mainnet? it never manages to sync up with the last block. In a few days it reached 17.5 M blocks but after 2 weeks it doesn't get to synchronize with the last block, always 1 or 2 thousand blocks behind.

`it doesn't get to synchronize with the last block`: probably you using high-latency disk
show logs (especially Timings and Commit lines)
tell about hardware type

then maybe can give some recommendations

Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-10400 CPU @ 2.90GHz
32GB memory 
Samsung 870 QVO SSD 8TB SATA3

it takes 3-4 days  to reach  from  block 1 to 1 thousand behind top 

Since 06-27 18:50 log only in   2/15 Headers stage. Bellow log of the interval 

 [INFO] [06-27|18:50:48.915] [14/15 TxLookup] DONE                    in=5m29.83964276s
[INFO] [06-27|18:50:48.923] Timings (slower than 50ms)               Bodies=38m52.579s Senders=28.743s Execution=28m39.594s HashState=21m1.783s IntermediateHashes=21m30.806s CallTraces=9m0.024s AccountHistoryIndex=5m23.006s StorageHistoryIndex=8m26.331s LogIndex=5m15.053s TxLookup=5m29.839s

[INFO] [06-27|18:51:33.901] PoS headers verified and saved           requestId=1 fork head=0xb92b9dc89b6ccbdda7d3f31a8c88469167e63939b676a74a4b09d45efee076e9
[I
......
.....
[INFO] [06-28|13:29:36.366] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=17577526 hash=0xad31d195d3a057314d2ee543832afd0c9ac19638a5d5862d33bcd23bb6008151

[INFO] [06-28|13:30:06.896] [Caplin] P2P                             peers=9

Same here, we're running two nodes, one was ok, the other one was crashing because of the `no gaps in tx ids are allowed` issue fixed on 2.47.0, now after upgrade it periodically get synced but then lags quite a few blocks before syncing again.

